--- title: "In-class Exercise 06" author: "Leng Yi Xiu" date: "Sep 30 2024" date-modified: "last-modified" execute: eval: true echo: true message: false freeze: true --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, tmap, tidyverse, plotly) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "hunan") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Reading layer `hunan' from data source `D:\2. SMU - MITB\Term 4\ISSS626 Geospatial\YX-Leng\ISSS626-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex06\data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields Geometry type: POLYGON Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812 Geodetic CRS: WGS 84 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_GDPPC.csv") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Rows: 1496 Columns: 3 â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ Delimiter: "," chr (1): County dbl (2): Year, GDPPC â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. ``` ::: ::: ðŸ’¡ *`spacetime()`* used to create a spatio-temporal cube ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC_st <- spacetime(GDPPC, hunan, .loc_col = "County", .time_col = "Year") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} is_spacetime_cube(GDPPC_st) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: ::: {.callout-important appearance="simple"} This method can only be used if the administrative boundaries are fixed, only attributes change. Dynamic space phenomena (e.g. natural disasters) cannot be tracked using this method. ::: ## Computing Gi\* ### Deriving the spatial weights ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} GDPPC_nb <- GDPPC_st %>% activate("geometry") %>% mutate(nb = include_self( st_contiguity(geometry)), wt = st_inverse_distance(nb, geometry, scale = 1, alpha = 1), .before = 1) %>% set_nbs("nb") %>% # This is to fix the sequence so that it is not sorted set_wts("wt") # This is to fix the sequence so that it is not sorted ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ! Polygon provided. Using point on surface. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There was 1 warning in `stopifnot()`. â„¹ In argument: `wt = st_inverse_distance(nb, geometry, scale = 1, alpha = 1)`. Caused by warning in `st_point_on_surface.sfc()`: ! st_point_on_surface may not give correct results for longitude/latitude data ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gi_stars <- GDPPC_nb %>% group_by(Year) %>% mutate(gi_star = local_gstar_perm( GDPPC, nb, wt)) %>% tidyr::unnest(gi_star) ``` ::: ## Mann-Kendall Test on Gi ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cbg <- gi_stars %>% ungroup() %>% filter(County == "Changsha") %>% select(County, Year, gi_star) ``` ::: ðŸ’¡ Plot using ggplot2 and wrapping it to an interactive Mann-Kendall Plot ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(data = cbg, aes(x = Year, y = gi_star)) + geom_line() + theme_light() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](In-class_Ex06_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- ggplot(data = cbg, aes(x = Year, y = gi_star)) + geom_line() + theme_light() ggplotly(p) # Interactive Plot ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cbg %>% summarise(mk = list( unclass( Kendall::MannKendall(gi_star)))) %>% tidyr::unnest_wider(mk) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 5 tau sl S D varS 1 0.485 0.00742 66 136. 589. ``` ::: ::: ### Mann-Kendall test data.frame ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ehsa <- gi_stars %>% group_by(County) %>% summarise(mk = list( unclass( Kendall::MannKendall(gi_star)))) %>% tidyr::unnest_wider(mk) head(ehsa) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 6 County tau sl S D varS 1 Anhua 0.191 0.303 26 136. 589. 2 Anren -0.294 0.108 -40 136. 589. 3 Anxiang 0 1 0 136. 589. 4 Baojing -0.691 0.000128 -94 136. 589. 5 Chaling -0.0882 0.650 -12 136. 589. 6 Changning -0.750 0.0000318 -102 136. 589. ``` ::: ::: ## Performing Emerging Hotspot Analysis ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ehsa <- emerging_hotspot_analysis( x = GDPPC_st, .var = "GDPPC", k = 1, nsim = 99 ) ``` :::
